intro: Cicer graecum, commonly known as Greek vetch, is an annual legume native to the Mediterranean region. It features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a taproot system and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. Its seeds are often used as a protein source in some traditional cuisines. Cicer graecum is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
